caption: A driving indie folk anthem with stomping drums, banjo, and passionate group vocals. Features acoustic guitars, mandolin accents, and a rousing sing-along chorus that builds to an euphoric climax.
lyrics:
[Intro]

[Verse 1]
We were born to run wild and free
Across the plains and the rolling sea
With nothing but the clothes on our backs
Following the railroad tracks

[Verse 2]
Campfire stories under the stars
Playing songs on old guitars
We don't need much to get by
Just good friends and open sky

[Chorus]
Hey ho here we go
Down the road where the wild winds blow
Hey ho sing it loud
We're the dreamers we're the proud

[Verse 3]
Every stranger is a friend
Every road has got an end
But the journey is the prize
Adventure in our eyes

[Chorus]
Hey ho here we go
Down the road where the wild winds blow
Hey ho sing it loud
We're the dreamers we're the proud

[Bridge]

Oh oh oh oh

[Final Chorus]
Hey ho here we go
We're the dreamers we're the proud
Hey ho!
